intro: Alsinanthus biflorus, commonly known as the two-flowered alsin, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, branched stems. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the spring. Alsinanthus biflorus is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for various insects and wildlife.
